revised_title: Swallow Migration and Winter Habits in the Rhine Region
tldr: The author shares a letter from Mr. Achard, who observed swallows taking refuge in holes in a cliff along the Rhine River during winter. He describes how the birds were retrieved by local boys and their revival after being warmed by their captors. This observation supports the idea that some swallows stay behind in these "dormitories" during winter, while others migrate away.
